<ce:section-title>Abstract</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para view="all">Na<ce:inf loc="post">x</ce:inf>Se<ce:inf loc="post">y</ce:inf> prepared by the reaction of sodium and selenium in liquid ammonia, has been reacted with Ph<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>PCI in THF/ethanol to give a mixture of Ph<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>PSeH, Ph<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>P(Se) OP(Se)Ph<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> and the title compound (<ce:bold>5</ce:bold>) which was characterized by X-ray crystallography. Compound <ce:bold>5</ce:bold> consists of a central polymeric core built up of Na(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O), and Na(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (thf)(Se) units with additional hydrogen-bonded Ph<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>PSe<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
<ce:sup loc="post">−</ce:sup> anions.</ce:simple-para>
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

NaxSey prepared by the reaction of sodium and selenium in liquid ammonia, has been reacted with Ph2PCI in THF/ethanol to give a mixture of Ph2PSeH, Ph2P(Se) OP(Se)Ph2 and the title compound (5) which was characterized by X-ray crystallography. Compound 5 consists of a central polymeric core built up of Na(H2O), and Na(H2O)3 (thf)(Se) units with additional hydrogen-bonded Ph2PSe2 - anions.

metadata.title: The X-ray crystal structure of Na2[Ph2PSe2]2sdThf·5H2OA polymer containing sixmembered sodium-water rings and sodium coordinated by selenium
